intro: Silene subleopoliensis, commonly known as the Leopoliensis campion, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Basin. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
